title: Chatura Alwis wins People’s TV Presenter of the Year Award for 8th consecutive year
byline: TV Derana’s Chatura Alwis won the “People’s Television Presenter of the Year” Award for the 8th consecutive year at the SLIM-KANTAR People’s Awards 2025 held this evening at the Monarch Imperial in Sri Jayawardenapura Kotte.

title: Fairly heavy showers expected in parts of the island
byline: The Meteorology Department says showers or thundershowers will occur at several places in Western, Sabaragamuwa, Central and North-western provinces and in Galle and Matara districts after 2.00 p.m.

title: NASA astronauts Butch Wilmore and Suni Williams return to Earth after 9 months stuck in space
byline: Stuck in space no more, NASA astronauts Butch Wilmore and Suni Williams returned to Earth on Tuesday, hitching a different ride home to close out a saga that began with a bungled test flight more than nine months ago.

title: NASA astronauts Butch Wilmore and Suni Williams return to Earth after 9 months stuck in space
byline: Stuck in space no more, NASA astronauts Butch Wilmore and Suni Williams returned to Earth on Tuesday, hitching a different ride home to close out a saga that began with a bungled test flight more than nine months ago.

title: Putin agrees in Trump call to pause Ukraine energy attacks but no full ceasefire
byline: President Vladimir Putin has rejected an immediate and full ceasefire in Ukraine, agreeing only to halt attacks on energy infrastructure, following a call with US President Donald Trump.

title: Three Indian fishermen arrested for poaching in Sri Lankan waters
byline: The Sri Lanka Navy seized an Indian fishing boat and apprehended 03 Indian fishermen while they were poaching in Sri Lankan waters, during a special operation conducted in the northern sea area off the Delft Island, Jaffna.

title: Sri Lanka economic growth picks up as IMF aid keeps flowing – report
byline: Sri Lanka’s economy grew faster than expected last quarter, indicating strong domestic activity backed by the International Monetary Fund’s aid.

title: 16-hour water cut in Katana today
byline: The National Water Supply and Drainage Board (NWSDB) has announced that the water supply will be suspended for 16 hours in several areas of Katana North today (19).

title: Former IGP Deshabandu Tennakoon appears before court
byline: The former Inspector General of Police (IGP) Deshabandu Tennakoon has appeared before the Matara Magistrate’s Court this morning (19), sources told Ada Derana.

title: 12 killed in Honduras plane crash, including Garifuna musician Aurelio Martínez Suazo
byline: A small commercial plane crash off the coast of Honduras left 12 people dead, including a well-known Garifuna musician, authorities said.

title: Speaker bans live broadcast of MP Archchuna’s speeches in parliament
byline: The Speaker of Parliament, Dr. Jagath Wickramaratne, has announced a ban on the live broadcast of Jaffna District MP Ramanathan Archchuna’s statements on audiovisual and social media for the next eight parliamentary sessions, starting tomorrow (20).

title: Public Security Minister makes statement after ex-IGP Deshabandu’s surrender
byline: Minister of Public Security, Ananda Wijepala, made a special statement in Parliament today (19) regarding former Inspector General of Police (IGP) Deshabandu Tennakoon, who surrendered to court this morning.

title: Deadline for placing deposits for LG Elections ends today
byline: The Election Commission has announced that the process for placing deposits for the Local Government Elections is scheduled to conclude at 12:00 noon today (19).

title: SC dismisses petition by ex-President Mahinda Rajapaksa
byline: The Supreme Court today (19) dismissed a fundamental rights petition filed by former President Mahinda Rajapaksa, challenging the government’s decision to reduce his security reserve to 60 officers without proper evaluation.
